item.title: The Outer Worlds 2 Release Time
item.description:
The Outer Worlds 2 is the final major Xbox-published title releasing in 2025, courtesy of Obsidian Entertainment. Whisking players off to a galaxy where corporations and capitalism reign supreme. With plenty of skills to unlock, enemies to blast, quests to complete, and companions to meet, it's a healthy dose of RPG action that's sure to keep you playing for hours. If you're wondering what time The Outer Worlds 2 releases, you're not the only one, and for a few reasons, it's a little more complicated than usual.

What Time Does The Outer Worlds 2 Release?

Early Access and Daylight Saving Time Make Things Complicated

The Outer Worlds 2 has two different release dates and times, as it has an early access period tied to its more expensive Premium Edition. Those who buy the premium edition will be able to begin playing from October 24, while those who pick up the standard edition can start playing from October 29 . It's worth noting that the Game Pass version of the game is the standard edition, but you can purchase the Premium Edition upgrade separately if you want to get the five days of early access via Game Pass too.

Location / Time Zone

Early Access Release Time

Standard Edition Release Time

Los Angeles (PT)

9:00 PM (October 23)

10:00 AM (October 29)

Mexico City (CT)

10:00 PM (October 23)

11:00 AM (October 29)

New York (ET)

12:00 AM (October 24)

1:00 PM (October 29)

Sao Paulo (BRT)

1:00 AM (October 24)

2:00 PM (October 29)

London (GMT)

5:00 AM (October 24)

5:00 PM (October 29)

Stockholm (CET)

6:00 AM (October 24)

6:00 PM (October 29)

Cairo (EEST)

8:00 AM (October 24)

8:00 PM (October 29)

9:00 AM (October 24)

9:00 PM (October 29)

New Delhi (UTC)

10:30 AM (October 24)

10:30 PM (October 29)

Hanoi (ICT)

12:00 AM (October 24)

12:00 AM (October 30)

Tokyo (JST)

1:00 PM (October 24)

2:00 AM (October 30)

Sydney (AEDT)

3:00 PM (October 24)

4:00 AM (October 30)

Auckland (NZDT)

5:00 PM (October 24)

6:00 AM (October 30)

Between the early access and standard edition releases for The Outer Worlds 2 , daylight saving time will end in some regions, such as the UK. As a result, it can be difficult to predict exact release times for certain regions. This also explains why the time difference between the UK and the US is different between the two editions.

These times are based on the expected release times shared on the PlayStation Store. It's worth noting that release times can occasionally differ on platforms. We've done our best to verify the release times in the chart above, so you can get playing as soon as possible.

The Outer Worlds 2

item.title: Bethesda Confirms What It Will Be Showing on Fallout Day
item.description:
Bethesda has revealed an early teaser for some of the announcements to come during its Fallout Day community event, including new content for Fallout 76 , special merchandise drops, and in-person fan meet-ups. Fallout has drawn in audiences across multiple decades, now spanning from video games to a hit television series, and the first reveals for Fallout Day 2025 are already sparking enthusiasm among fans.

Following the lore of the Fallout video game franchise, October 23, 2077 is the day of the Great War that caused catastrophic global damage and kicked off the post-apocalyptic timeline of the series. In 2024, Bethesda declared October 23 to be the official Fallout Day, where fans can celebrate the games and tune into a broadcast of new updates coming to the franchise. The special occasion for 2025 will be only the second-ever official Fallout Day, and Bethesda has confirmed a full slate of exciting announcements.

Fallout Day 2025

Fallout Day 2025 will feature a special broadcast starting at 1pm ET on Thursday, October 23, including announcements for the Fallout 76: Burning Springs Update, Fallout Shelter , Fallout 4 and Creations, new merchandise drops, community in-person events, and a post-show celebrating the community. Burning Springs , set to launch sometime in December 2025, will see the game's second expansion of the Appalachia world map and will feature new quests plus an appearance by The Ghoul from the Amazon Prime Fallout TV show. 2025 marks the 10th Anniversary of the original release of Fallout 4 , which may have influenced its planned inclusion in the broadcast, and the year also brings the 15th Anniversary of Fallout: New Vegas , leaving many hopeful for that game to make a surprise appearance during Fallout Day 2025.

Audiences will be able to tune into the official Fallout Day 2025 Broadcast on YouTube, Twitch, and Steam, with the livestream expected to run anywhere from 30 minutes to over an hour, followed by the post-show celebration. Previous predictions for Fallout Day 2025 are now aligning with the confirmed lineup, though it remains to be seen just how much new official game content will be revealed and how much of the broadcast will focus on community activities.

Widely considered to be one of the best post-apocalyptic video games of all time, it should come as no surprise that the second official Fallout Day is quickly drawing a crowd, with many keeping their fingers crossed for additional secret announcements on new adventures through the Wasteland. Interested fans can stay tuned for updates on the content revealed at Fallout Day 2025 and other future news about the Fallout franchise.

item.title: When Does Season 1 Start for Battlefield 6?
item.description:
Battlefield 6 has dropped and is already being widely considered one of the best shooters of the year, releasing to overwhelming success across all platforms. With a return to a modern setting, large-scale modes featuring all-out war, and some seriously good gameplay and cinematic moments, fans jumping into Battlefield 6 for the first time are sure to have a blast.

However, while Battlefield 6’s launch is still fresh, even more content is on the way, and much sooner than many might expect. Battlefield 6 Season 1 is on the horizon, bringing new maps, modes, and unique weapons into the mix. While many may be wondering when exactly Season 1 kicks off, EA and DICE have already shared details on what’s to come and when to expect it. Here’s when Battlefield 6 Season 1 releases.

When Does Season 1 Start for Battlefield 6?

Battlefield 6 Season 1 officially releases on Tuesday, October 28, across PC (Steam and EA App), Xbox Series X/S, and PlayStation 5. However, the exact time that Season 1 launches is currently unknown, though it will likely go live around 8 AM PT to coincide with the game's initial release time on October 10. Ahead of its release, all players will be able to pre-download the update, allowing them to jump in as soon as it goes live.

Battlefield 6 Season 1 Full Breakdown

Battlefield 6 Season 1's content will be split into three major drops , one each month starting October 28, with the final drop arriving on December 9. All the content coming to the game will be completely free for Battlefield 6 owners, with the only exception being the Season 1 Battle Pass. Here is a full breakdown of the content coming with Battlefield 6 Season 1:

Rogue Ops (Oct 28)

Rogue Ops kicks off at the start of Season 1 on October 28 , bringing a sizable chunk of new content into the game. Rogue Ops introduces Blackwell Fields , taking players to the California backlands of a newly recommissioned American air base. The map supports all combat sizes and includes both land and air vehicles for applicable modes.

Rogue Ops also introduces a new game mode called Strikepoint , a 4v4 mode where two teams must fight to capture an objective across multiple rounds. Players only have one life, meaning rounds can be won or lost once all members of a team are eliminated, or if the objective is successfully captured. The mode takes place on CQB-scale maps, similar to those featured in the Close Quarters Battle playlist.

A new vehicle also joins the fight, the APC Traverser Mark 2. This land vehicle features a roof gunner and two passenger backseat gunners and is designed to fend off enemy infantry. That’s not all though, as Rogue Ops also brings several new weapons and loadout options. These include:

  • SOR-300C: A carbine with a low rate of fire and above-average damage. Uses .300 Blackout ammunition by default.
  • Mini Fix: A lightweight bolt-action sniper rifle similar to the Scout Elite.
  • GGH-22: A sidearm equipped in the secondary slot. It features high ammo capacity, a high fire rate, and low damage.
  • Rail Cover & Low-Powered Variable Optic: Two new attachments that are available for Rifles and LMGs.

California Resistance (Nov 18)

California Resistance begins on November 18, introducing the new map, Eastwood, into the mix. Eastwood takes players to a golf course and Californian suburbs, featuring drivable golf carts and supports all combat sizes, along with land vehicles and helicopters for applicable modes. The new mode, Sabotage, also debuts with California Resistance, where two teams of eight must battle it out to defend or attack different sites before the round timer ends. The team that detonates the most sites wins the match.

Battle Pickups also return on November 18, serving as powerful weapons that players can find in the wild. The specific weapons available have yet to be revealed. Moving on to current loadout options, California Resistance brings the following:

  • DB-12: A dual-barreled pump-action shotgun that can fire two shots with two pulls of the trigger before needing to be rechambered.
  • M327 Trait: A sidearm equipable in the secondary slot. It’s an eight-chamber revolver with high damage and a low fire rate, designed primarily for CQB combat.
  • Slim Handstop: An alternative to underbarrel attachments that improve ergonomics and handling.

Winter Defensive (Dec 9)

The final drop for Season 1 is Winter Defensive, starting December 9, which brings Ice Lock Empire State into Battlefield 6 . This map variant is a frozen take on Empire State and will only be available for a limited time before reverting to its regular version once Season 1 ends. Winter Defensive also introduces the Ice Lock Event, a new gameplay modifier that will only be available in select experiences, most likely in modes set on Ice Lock Empire State.

The only other piece of content currently confirmed for Winter Defensive is the arrival of the Ice Climbing Axe. This melee weapon joins the existing lineup of knives and the sledgehammer.

All the weapons featured in Battlefield 6 Season 1 will be unlockable through the Season 1 Battle Pass for free. The Battle Pass will initially feature four tracks, the first four of which will roll out with the upcoming content drops, with a fifth track that can be unlocked once the previous tracks have been completed.

Will Battlefield 6 Season 1 Feature a Battle Royale Mode?

While Battlefield 6’s Battle Royale mode is currently rumored to release on October 28 alongside the start of Season 1 , DICE and EA have yet to confirm its actual release date or whether it will be included as part of the Season 1 content lineup. Battlefield 6 Battle Royale will be free-to-play, with more details on its release expected to be revealed soon.

Battlefield 6
9 /10
22
8.6 /10
Released
October 10, 2025

item.title: How to Complete 'Klefki's Lost Key' Mission in Pokemon Legends Z-A
item.description:
Side Mission 106 in Pokemon Legends: Z-A (Klefki's Lost Key) cannot be started until after you reach Rank A in the Z-A Royale, but it'll involve you having to find a lost key for a Pokemon trainer named Cadena who owns a Klefki .

She and her Klefki were hanging out around the city when the Pokemon accidentally dropped a key, but the game won't tell you exactly where it is. However, she will drop a couple of hints to help players out:

  • It's near a hair salon.
  • It's also close to a café.
  • And it's also near a Battle Court.

If you don't want to waste time looking for the key, this guide will help Pokemon Legends Z-A trainers out. Here's how to complete the ' Klefki's Lost Key ' mission.

Where is the Missing Key for 'Klefki's Lost Key' Mission in PLZA?

It's on a Battle Court!

To easily find the missing key, you'll need to head to the Battle Court in Vert Sector 9 (it's on the side street just north of the Salon near the Stone Emporium (close to Wild Zone 12).

If you fast travel to the Pokemon Center outside Aymlis Park, immediately start walking south and then turn left when you see an alley (if you've hit the Stone shop, you've gone too far!)

Down the alley, you'll see the battle court on the left-hand side. Go inside it, and you will see a shiny red item on the floor (this is the missing fancy key for Cadena). Once you grab it, a cutscene will happen, and Cadena will show up with Klefki to thank you and offer a reward.

Reward for Klefki's Lost Key Mission in Pokemon Legends Z-A

For finding the lost key, Cadena will give you...

5000 Poke Dollars

x1 Nugget

Nuggets are made of pure gold and can be sold to shops for a whopping 5000 Poke Dollars.

54
4.8 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: How to Get All Mythical and Legendary Pokemon in Pokemon Legends Z-A
item.description:
Mega Evolutions are great and all, but for most players, catching Mythical and Legendary Pokemon is still one of the most enjoyable parts of any Pokemon game. Unfortunately, however, Pokemon Legends: Z-A falls a little short in this regard, with only three Legendaries available for players to catch at launch.

Series fans can perhaps take some comfort from the fact that two more Legendaries are already present in the game's files, and many more look set to return when the Mega Dimension DLC is released in early 2026. Until then, though, here's how to catch all three of the Legendary Pokemon in Pokemon Legends: Z-A .

All Mythical and Legendary Pokemon in Pokemon Legends: Z-A

Xerneas

Yveltal

Zygarde

How to Get Xerneas in Pokemon Legends: Z-A

Players can catch Xerneas during the "The One That Gives" Main Mission, which becomes available during the post-game. Before they can find Xerneas, they'll need to catch or defeat three Alpha Pokemon, after which, Xerneas will appear in Wild Zone 11.

How to Get Yveltal in Pokemon Legends: Z-A

Players can catch Yveltal during the "The One That Takes" Main Mission, which becomes available during the post-game. Before they can find Yveltal, they'll need to defeat three Rogue Mega Evolutions as part of a simulation, after which, Yveltal will appear on the roof of Galerie de la Lune in Rouge Sector 2.

How to Get Zygarde in Pokemon Legends: Z-A

Players can get Zygarde during the "To Keep the World in Balance" Main Mission, which becomes available after completing "The One That Gives" and "The One That Takes". Before they can catch Zygarde, they'll need to defeat L, after which, they'll need to beat Zygarde in its 10%, 50%, and complete forms.
